properties.description: Opened by Lord Rosebery, an ornate building with elegant decor influenced by the Art Nouveau movement. Several notable rooms including the Great Hall with unique stained glass, antique mirrors and Clerkenwell Angel statuettes.
properties.name: The Old Finsbury Town Hall

properties.description: Grade I listed 1934 residential block of flats in Hampstead, designed by the Canadian modernist architect Wells Coates for clients Jack and Molly Pritchard. English Heritage blue plaque for Bauhaus masters Gropius, Breuer and Moholy-Nagy.
properties.name: Isokon Building (Lawn Road Flats)

properties.description: Houses the City of London's art collection, built over remains of London's Roman amphitheatre. Façade uses Portland stone and Collyweston stone slates. Interior uses finishes of marble, American elm, damask and painted wall coverings.
properties.name: Guildhall Art Gallery

properties.description: Part of an international family of Ismaili Centres, a religious, cultural and social space for the Shia Imami Ismaili Muslims. The serenity of the entrance fountain to the roof garden reflects Muslim traditions in architecture and design
properties.name: The Ismaili Centre

properties.description: A unique II* listed Italianate church by John Dando Sedding with attached Campanile and Institute Building. Of particular significance in the church is the imposing baldacchino over the High Altar, which dominates the east end.
properties.name: The Church of Our Most Holy Redeemer

properties.description: Grade I listed early medieval parish church (from 952 before Tower of London) in spacious churchyard. Fine interior: Anglo-Saxon Rood, Norman font, 'squint', fine memorials incl founders of Trinity House, 1950s glass. Bells of Stepney.
properties.name: St Dunstan and All Saints Church

properties.description: One of London's best Victorian churches and a key building in the history of the Gothic Revival. Polychromatic brickwork, with internal art work by G.F. Watts and Thomas Earp, windows and painted ceiling by Clayton and Bell. Grade I listed.
properties.name: St James the Less Church

properties.description: Learn about the built environment of the City of London. The interactive 1:500 scale Pipers model contains an overview of the City with the latest developments and architecture. See the future skyline with all of the proposed new towers.
properties.name: The City Centre

properties.description: Barking town centre has seen significant development over recent years with substantial growth in housing and infrastructure. These guided tours will visit existing award winning schemes and set out the vision for the future of the town.
properties.name: Barking Town Centre Tour

properties.description: This Grade II* listed building includes an Adam-style ceiling (first floor) and two beautiful staircases with wrought-iron balustrades. Once home to the Pharmaceutical Society of Great Britain, it now houses a historical research institute.
properties.name: German Historical Institute

properties.description: A modern 4-storey building incorporating the much-loved Victorian library. The galleries and feature walls display exhibitions and contemporary art and a dramatic central atrium provides natural ventilation and daylight throughout.
properties.name: The Library at Willesden Green

properties.description: Maggie's Barts opened in December 2017. Maggie's Centres are unique, welcoming and uplifting places with qualified staff on hand to provide free practical, emotional and social support for people with cancer, their families and friends.
properties.name: Maggie's Barts

properties.description: The Aga Khan Centre, designed by Pritzker prize winning architect Fumihiko Maki, houses the UK institutions of the Aga Khan Development Network. A unique feature are its six gardens inspired by different regions of the Muslim world.
properties.name: Aga Khan Centre

properties.description: Quintain, the award-winning team behind the £3bn regeneration of Wembley Park, will host a series of guided tours of Wembley Park's emerging 7-acre Union Park and other new green spaces across the neighbourhood.
properties.name: Putting the Park in Wembley Park: an exclusive preview of Wembley Park's emerging Union Park and botanical tour of the neighbourhood's green spaces.

properties.description: The Estorick Collection is housed in a beautiful Georgian building previously known as Northampton Lodge. Today, the museum comprises six galleries over three floors, as well as a library, offices, a café and bookshop.
properties.name: Estorick Collection of Modern Italian Art

properties.description:
The Church was built in 1839/41 as a white 'Hall-Church'. 
The 1870s Gothic Revivalism was overseen to a very high standard, by James Brooks and helped by 10 top craftsmen of the day. We also have a WWI Memorial by Violet Pinwill.
properties.name: St Margaret's Church, Lee

properties.description: Belle Vue is a holistic retirement community, set within landscaped courts and gardens with communal and neighbourhood facilities.
properties.name: Belle Vue

properties.description: The museum is situated in a shopfront in Leegate Shopping Centre, which has been described by the Evening Standard as "the worst shopping precinct in the country."
properties.name: Museum of Neoliberalism

properties.description: Becontree Estate two storey cottage house with garden located on a banjo.
properties.name: Alderman Jones House

properties.description: Reliance Arcade is a Grade II Listed covered market in Brixton, London.  The Arcade was constructed in the 1920s and is home to 40 small retail units catering largely to local African-Caribbean communities.
properties.name: Reliance Arcade

properties.description: A grand riverside Victorian pub, named after Horatio Nelson's victory at the Battle of Trafalgar. Featuring hundreds of original paintings on the walls.
properties.name: Trafalgar Tavern

properties.description: How can housing designed for nature and community impact on health and wellbeing, and create more crisis-resilient neighbourhoods?
properties.name: Sociable housing in a time of social distancing

properties.description: School and former school buildings dot the urban landscape - from Bluecoat Schools, Ragged Schools and huge numbers of Board Schools they tell the history of education in London.
properties.name: Celebrating workplaces of key workers: The Story of Schools - a virtual tour with a London Blue Badge Tourist Guide

properties.description:
A virtual Thames river cruise from Hampton Court Palace to Kew Gardens seeing 3 palaces, 2 stately homes plus the residences of the rich and famous, all set in beautiful scenery.
Led by Anna Targett who focuses on period, palaces and pomp.
properties.name: London Borough of Richmond upon Thames - a virtual tour with a London Blue Badge Tourist Guide

properties.description: The interior of the building was redesigned in 2014 by John Pardey  to combine a craft gallery with a live work space for the gallery owner. Inspired by Kettle's Yard Flow space exhibits ceramics, glass, wood, textiles and jewellery.
properties.name: Flow Gallery

properties.description: Completed in Summer 2021, the National Youth Theatre has been redeveloped to double its capacity for studio space and was designed with young people, for young people. Recipient of the Mayor of London's Good Growth Fund.
properties.name: National Youth Theatre

properties.description: The four-story Church façade and prominent seven-story tower is covered in Portland stone and highlighted by a golden steeple. The interior features the Christus statue and a large mural of the resurrected Jesus Christ.
properties.name: Hyde Park Chapel

properties.description: Wren designed building of 1675, interior lost in blitz of 1940, reopened 1957 with 'Wren inspired' interior
properties.name: St Bride's Church, Fleet Street

properties.description:
Visitors will be shown around Boston Manor Park on short walks led by volunteers, focusing on the History of Boston Manor House and area.
The House is closed as part of a 5 year redevelopment project, re-opening in Autumn/Winter 2022.
properties.name: Boston Manor House and Park Walks

properties.description:
Ripple Greenway is a beautiful 14-acre linear park and art trail.  Home to Katy Hallett’s steel sculptures, inspired by Robert Macfarlane’s and Jackie Morris’ The Lost Words.
Wooden play and exercise equipment, picnic tables and benches.
properties.name: Ripple Greenway and the Lost Words Art Trail

properties.description: The Museum of Enfield is this year bringing its temporary exhibition to you! “From Enfield to Fork” explores the borough’s history and relationship with food, from Roman Enfield to Market Gardening.
properties.name: Enfield To Fork - Edmonton Green Shopping Centre

properties.description: Studio Hallett Ike take We Design Homes through a journey of award-winning home the ‘ER Residence’, as well as other upcoming exceptionally designed homes driven by a want to deliver meaningful, articulate and passionate architecture.
properties.name: Creating thoughtful homes with Studio Hallett Ike

properties.description: A collage art exhibition. Every day except Monday and Tuesday. A talk "Why Collage?" on Sunday evening at 7, followed by a Q&A and an art raffle for charity
properties.name: Dreamings collage art exhibition

properties.description: st ann's
properties.name: St. Ann's Hospital

properties.description: Join architects, Pollard Thomas Edwards on an afternoon of ‘post occupancy evaluation by bike’, a fun way to analyse the impact of some of their completed projects in central London.
properties.name: Cycle the City with PTE

properties.description: The walk is around Old Malden and covers residential developments within the district. Different styles of suburban architecture includes a selection of modernist housing. There are also historic buildings and other places of interest.
properties.name: Self-guided Old Malden Walk

properties.description: We'll take inspiration from Covent Garden's streets and architecture to explore practical ways to support mental wellbeing and find pools of calm in the buzz and bustle, with opportunities for discussion and reflection along the way.
properties.name: The Architecture of Wellbeing: Covent Garden

properties.description: A pioneering thatched building for the University of East Anglia, designed according to whole-life carbon principles and with the innovative use of natural and bio-based materials . Shortlisted for the Open City Stewardship Awards 2021.
properties.name: Enterprise Centre

properties.description: Focussing on how the South Bank’s unique location and pattern of land ownership has shaped its history, the tour will address how businesses, communities, and locals have played a part in the area’s growth, management, and conservation
properties.name: ‘A tonic to the nation’: South Bank 1951-2021
